intro: Didymopanax rubiginosus, commonly known as the red-stemmed holly or Brazilian holly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that mature to a bright red color, attracting various bird species. Didymopanax rubiginosus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
